Package EnvironmentAPI

Class PollutionEnvironment

java.lang.Object
EnvironmentAPI.PollutionEnvironment
public class PollutionEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
Based on https://github.com/NathanMacLeod/Fluid-Simulation/blob/master/src/fluidsimulation/FluidSimulation.java Further based on: https://www.researchgate.net/publication/2560062_Real-Time_Fluid_Dynamics_for_Games

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addSource​(Source source)
    Add a source to the list of sources of this pollution environment
    void clear()
    Clears all values!
    void doStep​(double currentTime, Environment environment)
    Updates the environment every x calls to this function (can be changed if more precision is wanted)
    double getDensity​(org.jxmapviewer.viewer.GeoPosition position, Environment environment, double MaxValue)
    Returns the current pollution at this spot.

    Resets the environment

  • Method Details

    • addSource

      public void addSource​(Source source)
      Add a source to the list of sources of this pollution environment
      Parameters:
      source - the source to add.

    • getDensity

      public double getDensity​(org.jxmapviewer.viewer.GeoPosition position, Environment environment, double MaxValue)
      Returns the current pollution at this spot.
      Parameters:
      position - position to search the pollution from
      environment - environment where the position is situated in
      MaxValue - MaxValue to return
      Returns:
      The pollution if it doesn't exceed the maxvalue

    • doStep

      public void doStep​(double currentTime, Environment environment)
      Updates the environment every x calls to this function (can be changed if more precision is wanted)
      Parameters:
      currentTime - Time to add pollution at.
      environment - Environment where the pollution is situated

    • getSources

      public java.util.List<Source> getSources()

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the environment

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears all values!
